subclassFeature.name: College of Metronomes
entries: Bards of the College of Metronomes often value technical mastery over impassioned performance. Experts in the theory and craft behind music, their songs assert harmony in the face of dissonance, able to orchestrate even the chaos of battle into a perfect cadence.

subclassFeature.name: Adagio/Allegro
entries: Whenever combat starts and you aren't {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration to add or subtract your Charisma modifier from one creature's initiative roll (unwilling creatures can make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC to avoid this).

subclassFeature.name: A Piacere
entries: You can use your bonus action to tie a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to your music's rhythm, increasing its speed by 10 feet until your next turn ends.

Additionally, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration as part of using this feature. When you do so, the affected creature also gains the effects of the {@spell kinetic jaunt|scc} spell for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Da Capo al Fine
entries: Your music inspires perfectionist zeal, turning failure into success through sheer rote repetition. Each creature under the effect of your Countercharm can use its reaction to expend a Hit Die and reroll one ability check, saving throw, or attack roll. The creature makes this decision after seeing whether its roll succeeds or fails.
Additionally, as part of using your Countercharm feature, you can expend a spell slot or a use of your Bardic Inspiration to change its duration to 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Largo/Presto
entries: When you use your Countercharm feature, or as an action on subsequent turns while it is active, you can also cause it to perform one of the following effects, which lasts until the end of your next turn:

items: You and each friendly creature within its range gain the effects of the {@spell haste} spell (recipients do not experience lethargy once the effects end).
Each hostile creature within its range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be inflicted with the effects of the {@spell slow} spell.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your bard level, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
